title: Fork, 1985-103-172, ca. 1700–1800
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description: Four tines, slightly curved. Sloping shoulders, baluster-shaped neck. Plain silver ferrule, octagonal in section. Carved ivory handle: a woman in costume wearing a hat (German?), holding an instrument (hurdy-gurdy) under one arm, the other arm resting on the back. The head of the woman is moveable.
